docs.title: Welcome to Odd One Out!
docs.text: A game of deception, misdirection, and deduction.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Dive into a world where secrets and strategies collide in "Odd One Out". All players are assigned a role at a secret location, except for the 'odd one out' who is left guessing. Your mission: uncover the odd one out through strategic questioning, while keeping the location hidden.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Ready to join the intrigue? Here’s how you can start:

  • Join a Game: Enter with an access code from an existing game's creator.
  • Create a Game: Select location packs, set a time limit, and choose your playing mode. Share the generated access code for others to join.

docs.title: Gameplay
docs.text: Once the game begins, players will see their role and location (except the odd one out), the time limit countdown, and a list of players and potential locations. Question each other to find the odd one out, or, if you are the odd one, deduce the location before getting caught!

docs.title: How to Win
docs.text: Be the master of deduction to win. Players must identify the odd one out, and the odd one out must guess the location correctly to win. Time and wit are of the essence!

docs.title: Download Now
docs.text:
Join the excitement and challenge your deduction skills. Get "Odd One Out" on the Play Store!

Download from Play Store

docs.title: Privacy Policy for Odd One Out
docs.text: Last Updated: Jan 21st, 2024

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Welcome to "Odd One Out". This Privacy Policy describes how we collect, use, process, and disclose your information, including personal information, in conjunction with your access to and use of the "Odd One Out" app.

docs.title: 1.1 Analytics Data
docs.text: We use Firebase Analytics to collect data about your interactions with our app. This may include pages visited, game features used, and overall app interaction.

docs.title: 1.2 Contact Form
docs.text: When you use our contact form, we collect your name and email address for communication purposes.

docs.title: 1.3 AdMob
docs.text: Our app uses AdMob to display ads, which may collect information independently for advertising purposes.

We have made efforts to understand and respect the GDPR requirements. However, we cannot guarantee full compliance with the GDPR. As such, our services are not offered to residents of the European Union, and we do not knowingly collect or process data from EU residents.

Users can request access to or deletion of their personal data collected by us. To make such a request, please use the 'Contact Us' form available in the app settings. We will process and respond to your request in accordance with applicable law.
We retain your personal data only for as long as necessary to provide our services and for legitimate business purposes.
We are committed to ensuring the security of your personal information and employ various security measures to protect it.
We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.

If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us through our app's 'Contact Us' form.

Last Updated: Jan 21st, 2024

docs.title: Terms of Service for Odd One Out
docs.text: Last Updated: Jan 21st, 2024

docs.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
docs.text: 1.1 By accessing or using the "Odd One Out" app (the "Service"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service ("Terms"). If you disagree with any part of the terms, you are not permitted to access the Service.

docs.title: 2. Use of the Service
docs.text: 2.1 "Odd One Out" provides a social deduction game accessible through mobile devices. 2.2 The Service is intended for users who are at least 13 years of age. Users under 13 are not permitted to use the Service.

docs.title: 4. User Conduct
docs.text: 4.1 You agree not to use the Service to engage in any illegal, harmful, or offensive conduct. 4.2 You are responsible for all content you transmit or submit through the Service.

docs.title: 5. Intellectual Property
docs.text: 5.1 All rights, title, and interest in and to the Service (excluding user-generated content) are and will remain the exclusive property of "Odd One Out" and its licensors.

docs.title: 6. Privacy and Data Protection
docs.text: 6.1 By using the Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

docs.title: 7. Modifications to the Service and Terms
docs.text: 7.1 "Odd One Out" reserves the right to modify or discontinue the Service at any time without notice. 7.2 We may revise these Terms from time to time. The most current version will always be posted on our website.

docs.title: 8. Disclaimer of Warranties
docs.text: 8.1 The Service is provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis. "Odd One Out" makes no warranties regarding the Service, express or implied.

docs.title: 9. Limitation of Liability
docs.text: 9.1 "Odd One Out" shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages resulting from your access to or use of the Service.

docs.title: 10. Governing Law
docs.text: 10.1 These Terms shall be governed by the laws of the jurisdiction in which our company is established, without regard to its conflict of law principles.

docs.title: 11. Contact Information
docs.text:
11.1 If you have any questions or concerns about this Terms of Service or our data practices, please contact us through our app's 'Contact Us' form.

Last Updated: Jan 21st, 2024

docs.title: Third-Party Services and Libraries Used in Our App
Firebase Services
docs.text: • Firebase Database, Auth, Storage, Firestore, Analytics, Crashlytics: Used for backend services like user authentication, data storage, analytics, and crash reporting.

docs.title: Google Services
docs.text: • Google Play Services Ads: Provides advertisement services within the app.

docs.title: User Interface and Design
docs.text:
• AndroidX Libraries: Core components for building the app's interface and functionality.
  • Material Components: Design elements based on Google's Material Design to enhance the app's look and feel.
  • Lottie: For smooth and engaging animations.

docs.title: Programming and Architecture
docs.text:
• Kotlin and Coroutines: The main programming language and framework for asynchronous tasks.
  • Dagger and Hilt: Dependency injection frameworks to ensure a robust and scalable app architecture.

docs.title: Testing and Quality Assurance
docs.text: • Robolectric and Espresso: Tools used for testing to ensure app reliability and performance.

docs.title: Additional Components
docs.text:
• AndroidX Browser: For web-related functionalities.
  • Custom View Pooling Container: Enhances performance for complex views.

Note: The list above includes major third-party services and libraries that have a direct impact on your experience in our app. We are committed to transparency and the responsible handling of user data.
